MS MCQs

    Create a Power Automate button that uses a physical button input

    »

    1. Which of the following are the click settings that are available in Flic that you can use when building a flow?

      click

      click, double-click, and hold

      click and double-click

      click, double-click, triple-click, and hold.


    2. Which connector is used to get manager information?

      Office 365 Users User Profile (V2)

      Office 365 Users User Properties (V2)

      Office 365 Users Get Manager (V2)

      Get Manager


    3. Does the Flic trigger provide the username or user’s email address?

      Yes. By default, any flow that is run has the user’s email address.

      Yes. Both Flic and Power Automate use the same authentication (in other words, username and password).

      No. You would use the Get manager (V2) action to get the username and user’s email address information.

      No. You would use the Compose action to manually type the email address.


    4. Can the Get calendar view of events action show all your events for a day?

      Yes. It does, by default, show all your events for a day and no additional steps are needed.

      Yes. However, you must add the Start Time and the End Time correctly.

      No. It can only provide one event.

      No. It can only provide events on an hourly basis.


    5. Does Flic use your Office 365 username and password?

      No. You will have to register with Flic first and create a username and password.

      No. Flic does not need a username and password.

      Yes. You do not need to register with Flic.

      Yes. Your Office 365 account automatically synchronizes with Flic.
